data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: Little deli restaurant on the corner of Muirlands and La Paz. Surfing theme. Salads are good sized but are slightly spicy. My favorite sandwich is the beach bikini which is turkey, cream cheese, sprouts, cranberry. Delicious. Reasonable prices. They make the meal, you pick it up at the counter. No table service.

data.title: great service
data.text:
I don't often give a 5 star review.  The food was good and the service here was great. This was the 1st time we have eaten here and the staff left a wonderful impression.  Everyone we encountered was friendly, and full of smiles.  

The prices are moderate. We bought a XL sandwich and split it between the two of us and we still had leftovers.  (but then again we're old and don't eat as much as we used to)

Thumbs up the whole group!  We will be back.

data.title: Unbelievable
data.text: Everything and anything you want is here.  From great sandwiches to a true chili dog this place has it.  Roll the dice for 2$ beers, and a great variety if you can't roll the dice.  Surfboard tables add to the great decor.  The only downside is this place is small. altho they do have outside tables. This is a great place to eat.....we've hurt ourselves many a times here :)

data.title: Tons of variety
data.text: Cold sandwiches look good. We tried the hot ones, they were ok. Pineapples weren't too tasty. will definitely try the cold sandwiches next time. Soup was good.

data.title: Big Sandwiches, But Pricey
data.text: If you want a quality sandwich, this is the place to go. Forget Subway or those other crappy chain places, come here to indulge. They have many different things to choose from and the pastrami is to die for. Service can at times be slow, but everything is made upon your request, not done before hand. The food is not cheap, but if price is not that important, then this is your place to revel in delectable eats!

data.title: Marginally worth the wait
data.text: I've only used for takeout and often been told there is a 30-45 minute wait...for a single sandwich. Sandwiches and bread are very good but pricey.

data.title: great to have one here in Mission Viejo
data.text:
We tried Beach Hut deli, a few weeks after it opened and we were very much pleased .The sandwiches tasted really good, my pastrami sandwich did not last long. Neither the kids, burger and sandwich. They have the new soda dispenser where you can try out mixes of sodas. But the draft beer list was excellent. I had an IPA from a micro-brewery and just loved it. 
Kids would like to come back soon.

data.title: Great Sandwiches, average beverages
data.text: I had the Beach Burger, which is a roast beef sandwich.  It had ample amount of meat, and was large enough to be bulging and hard to hold.  It was very good. There were so many sandwiches on the menu that looked very tasty, I'll have to return and try a different one next time.  I also picked up one of the chocolate chip cookies near the cash register.  It was very good, not too dry, and seemed very fresh. The only disappointment for me is there isn't fresh brewed iced tea.  They have the Gold Peak tea which is a pre-brewed Coca cola product.  What they need is Lipton Fresh brewed Tropical tea to be the best sandwich shop around.  The other problem with the beverages is that Coke machine with all the varieties in one place.  Only one person can get a beverage at a time, and when you put your cup in to get ice, the soda spigot drips on your hand.  The Mission Viejo location is small, about 10 tables and many of them have their own TV.  They all seem to be on the same channel, so I don't know if you can choose your preferred programming.  We sat on the patio, and didn't realize that there are no speakers for when they announce that your food is ready.  Eventually, one of the servers came outside and asked if anyone with my name was sitting out there, even though all the patio tables were occupied except one, it seemed like they let our food sit quite awhile before seeing if we were outside.  I will definitely be back, probably take a sandwich to go and get a beverage elsewhere. We got three sandwiches, three drinks, and three extras (chips or cookies) and the cost was $45.  Not cheap, but very good and nice sized proportions.
